intro: Ervatamia pandacaqui, commonly known as the pandacaqui plant, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically used in local cuisine, particularly in traditional dishes from the Canary Islands. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky areas, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
